group.name: Diagnostic
group.string: Diagnostic data have been saved to {0}. Now you may send it to your system administrator or to contact person of Cisco Email Security Plug-In.

group.name: Core

An error occurred during {0} configuration file initialization. Some settings have been set to the default values.
Cannot generate new path for config file. Configuration will be not saved.

group.name: Core.Options
group.string: The Diagnostic tool collects all plug-in related information
Add security toolbar to main window
Add security toolbar to message window
Add message reporting options to right-click menu
Displays a list of available languages to select from
Browse to the location of the log file
Allows you to configure additional plug-in options
A log file writes and lists all actions that have occurred
Send anonymous usage data to Cisco to help us improve the Cisco Email Security Plug-in?
Send anonymous usage data to Cisco
Allow sending anonymous usage data to Cisco
A non-permanent identifier generated when the plug-in is first installed. It's used to correlate usage reports so usage over time can be tracked.
If you press this button all cached passphrases for all accounts will be deleted.
Clears all passphrases for all accounts
All passphrases for all accounts have been cleared.

group.name: Core.AboutBox
group.string:
This product contains cryptographic features and is subject to United States and local country laws governing import, export, transfer and use. Delivery of Cisco cryptographic products does not imply third-party authority to import, export, distribute or use encryption. Importers, exporters, distributors and users are responsible for compliance with U.S. and local country laws. By using this product you agree to comply with applicable laws and regulations. If you are unable to comply with U.S. and local laws, return this product immediately.
A summary of U.S. laws governing Cisco cryptographic products may be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/legal/export/pepd/Search.do

Warning: This computer program is protected by copyright law and international treaties. Unauthorized reproduction or distribution of this program, or any portion of it, may result in severe civil and criminal penalties, and will be prosecuted to maximum extent possible under the law.
Copyright © 2011—2016 Cisco Systems, Inc. and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
If you require further assistance please visit us at

group.name: Mso
group.string: Cisco Email Security Plug-In for Outlook can't be loaded.

group.string: You need to restart Outlook to apply changes.

Selected item is not a mail.

Please verify the following: -Make sure that your BCE account settings are correct. -Check that your network connection is working. -Verify that the connection to your email server is working. It can terminate unexpectedly. -Verify that your firewall software is configured properly. -Check that your antivirus software settings are correct.

group.name: Report.Options
group.string: Keep a copy of sent report
Display notification when a single email is reported successfully
Display notification when multiple emails are reported successfully
Reporting allows you to submit feedback to Cisco Systems about unsolicited or threatening messages

group.name: Mso.Report
group.string: Please restart Outlook. It seems that you have added an Outlook account. Cisco Email Security Spam Plug-In for Outlook may work incorrectly without Outlook restart.

group.name: Mso.Report.Button.ToolTips
group.string: Add this sender to your blocked senders list

group.name: Encryption.Options
group.string: Encryption allows you to send encrypted email using the Cisco encryption technology
Host and Port fields cannot be empty
Envelope attachment name cannot be empty and must contain valid file name characters.
Show 'Reply to all' button in the message bar
Show 'Reply' button in the message bar
Show 'Forward' button in the message bar
Your Outlook accounts are listed. For each of these accounts, you can apply different encryption settings.
Fidelity is currently the default encryption account. Would you like to make this account default?
Always use message body from key server
If you turn this feature off you will be using the list of message body templates from the plug-in and it differs from keyserver's list

group.name: DE.DecryptPassFormStrings
group.string: The message was transmitted securely but does not require a passphrase.
The message will be flagged and does not require a passphrase.
Due to the security level set for this message, a passphrase is always required.
Please specify or type appropriate email account.

group.string: The recipient of the Cisco Secure Envelope will see the following message before opening the envelope
Don't show this dialog next time

Recipients will receive message bodies specific to the language they've chosen on the key server. Original message may differ from this template

group.name: DE.PostXErrorCodesStrings
group.string: The envelope’s config file is incorrect.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid sdk’s configuration found.
An HTTP error occurred during connection to server.
An HTTP error occurred during connection to server: unable to resolve DNS name.
An HTTP error occurred during connection to server: unable to establish IP connection.
An HTTP error occurred during connection to server: unable to negotiate TLS connection.
An HTTP error occurred during connection to server: an error occurred during sending the request.
An HTTP error occurred during connection to server: an error occurred during reading the response.
An HTTP error occurred during connection to server: unable to break down TLS connection.
An HTTP error occurred during connection to server: unable to close the socket.
An error occurred during encryption: no recipients specified.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid email was specified for the RCPT field.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid email was specified for the To field.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid email was specified for the CC field.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid email was specified for the BCC field.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid email was specified for the From field.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid envelope builder property file was specified.
An error occurred during encryption: unable to create a unique identifier.
An error occurred during encryption: unable to build envelope.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid attachments found.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid reply URL was specified.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid register URL was specified.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid token was specified.
An error occurred during encryption: errors in the mime message.
An error occurred during encryption: incorrect cryptography passphrase was specified.
An error occurred during encryption: unknown algorithm specified.
An error occurred during encryption: an invalid email was specifed for the Reply-To field.
An error occurred during encryption: there is an encryption failur.
An error occurred during encryption: key server is not reachable.
Cannot open envelope - Malformed request sent to the server.
Cannot open envelope - Internal server error.
The message cannot be decrypted because it is expired. Please contact the sender for details.
Envelope has been permanently locked by the administrator.
Envelope has been temporarily locked and cannot be opened.
No keyserver record found for specified envelope.
This feature is available only after you complete registration by opening your first secure envelope.
This feature is available only after you complete registration. Click {0}here{1} to register.
KeyServer could not verify the token used for authentication.
This envelope was not sent to this recipient.
Your account has been suspended. Please try again in {0} minutes.
Recipient's user account is not activated.
Envelope has been locked by the server.
Your account has been locked. Please contact your administrator for more information.
The passphrase has expired. To reset your passphrase, log in through the websafe.
The message security level is too low.
The message security level is over maximum allowed.
Server is currently unavailable due to maintenance. Please try again later.
Cannot open envelope - Single Sign-On login required.
Cannot open envelope - Single Sign-On login failed.
Some parameters in BCE config are invalid.
an invalid offline passphrase was specified.
An invalid offline passphrase was specified.
The message cannot be decrypted because it is locked.
This message exceeds the allowable limit and cannot be encrypted.
This message exceeds the allowable limit and cannot be decrypted.
Java Runtime Environment is not found in your system. Please run plug-in installer or install JRE manually.
Please install Java Runtime Environment to encrypt, decrypt, or manage secure messages.
The expiration time you chose has already elapsed. Please choose a valid date.
The "Read By" time you chose has already elapsed. Please choose a valid date.
Your account has been blocked and you must reset your passphrase. Please use the forgot passphrase link to reactivate your account. {0}Forgot passphrase?{1}
Your account has been blocked because of too many incorrect passphrase attempts.
Envelope has been locked by the server.
An error occurred during loading messages from key server.
Bad Gateway: Proxy server received an invalid response from the upstream server.
An HTTP error occurred during connection to key server: remote host is not reachable.

Failed to apply new settings. Please verify that the attachment has a valid signature.

Unable to fully delete decrypted version of current email. Sensitive data loss is possible.To avoid losing date, search for newly created emails throughout your mailbox. From the top of the list find the decrypted email and permanently delete it.
This message could not be decrypted with the Cisco Email Security Plug-in. Please save this message and open it using your browser.
Unable to identify outgoing account. This email cannot be encrypted. Try to use another account or create a new email.

Only recipients can reply or forward this email

Specifies that system proxy settings are used
Specifies that manual proxy settings are used
Cache the passphrase for the specified amount of time
Specifies that messages are encrypted by default

Displays the Reply to all button in the message bar of the envelope
Opens email messages in the same window

Displays the “Remember envelop key” checkbox on the envelope

Displays the Reply button in the message bar of the envelope
Displays the Forward button in the message bar of the envelope

Sets the current account as the default
Sets the default language for outgoing messages

group.name: DE.MailOptionsToolTipStrings
group.string: Sets the security level for the current message
Sets the expiration time for the current message
Sets the read-by time for the current message
Sets the expiration day for the current message
Sets the read-by day for the current message
Sets the expiration date the for current message
Sets the read-by date for the current message
Sets the selected entries to expire on the specified date and time
Enter or change the reason that the selected entries are locked
Set the expiration day for the selected entries
Set the expiration time for the selected entries

group.name: DE.ManageMessagesToolTipStrings
group.string: Text used to perform a search of the "To" and "Subject" fields
Text used to perform a search of the field specified in the corresponding "in" drop-down menu

Additional text used to perform a search of the field specified in the corresponding "in" drop-down menu. If both keywords are specified, a search is performed to find email messages that have both keywords
Defines the field where the search for the primary keyword will be performed
Defines the field where the search for the secondary keyword will be performed
Perform a search for messages that have the specified status
Perform search for messages that have the specified number of the failed attempts
Perform a search for messages sent, opened, or expired after the specified date
Perform a search for messages sent, opened, or expired before the specified date
Perform a search for messages sent, opened, or expired after the specified time
Perform a search for messages sent, opened, or expired before the specified time
Specifies whether a search using a time internal will be performed on sent, opened, or expired messages
Collapses the view of all entries
Selects all entries (to be locked or expired)
Sets the number of entries that are displayed on each page

group.name: Core.CallHomeForms
group.string: The following data is collected and stored on Cisco servers for analysis in aggregate:

General info: • Identifier A non-permanent identifier generated when the plug-in is first installed. It's used solely to correlate usage reports so usage over time can be tracked. You can reset the identifier on the Plug-in Options > Additional Options > Privacy tab. • OS version • Outlook version • Plug-in version • Encryption SDK version The Encryption SDK is the library used internally by the plug-in to encrypt and decrypt secure messages. • OS language • Names of installed Outlook plug-ins
For each account configured in the plug-in: • Type • Server • Number of opened and sent secure messages • Total number of recipients • Feature usage counts Counts of the number of times various features have been used. • Whether non-standard reporting addresses are being used
You may also change this setting through the Plug-in options.

group.name: Encryption.RegistrationStrings
group.string: Enter a minimum of 8 characters or numbers. Passphrases are case-sensitive. Your passphrase must contain both letters and numbers.
Select a Language for CRES Account
You can also register by opening a
By registering, you agree to CRES's
Enter a short phrase that only you will know. This phrase will appear on the message envelopes when you log in. When you see your phrase, you know you are logging in to our secure site.
You will be asked these questions in future if you forget your passphrase.
Show answers to the Security Questions.
Hide answers to the Security Questions.
Select a question or enter your own security question…
Select or enter the question you will be asked when restoring your passphrase.
Select the question you will be asked when restoring your passphrase.
Enter your answer to the selected question.
Your Cisco Registered Envelope Service account was successfully created.
Instruction to activate your account have been emailed to {0}.
Please check your inbox. If you do not see an account activation email, check your junk email folder.
After you fill in the form, click here to proceed with advanced settings.
Click here to complete your registration.
Register now or click Advanced Settings to protect your account by setting security questions and personal security phrase.
Click cancel to cancel the registration process.
Click here to return to first page. Entered information will be lost.
After you fill in the form, click here to proceed with advanced settings.
to register or open a secure message again.
Your passphrase must be from {0} to {1} characters.
The passphrase must contain uppercase and lowercase letters.
The passphrase must contain at least one special character.
The passphrase cannot be the same as your email address.
The new passphrase and confirmation passphrase do not match. Please enter the passphrase again.
The passphrase must not contain a character repeated more than three times consecutively.
Passphrase must not be 'Cisco', 'ocsic' or any similar words by changing the capitalization of letters, or replacing 'i' with '1', '|', '!', 'o' with '0', or 's' with '$'.
The passphrase must contain characters from at least three of the following classes: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, digits, and special characters.
You must enter a first name.
You must enter a last name.
You must select three unique Security Questions.
Answer to the Security Question {0} cannot be the same as your email address.
The answer to the Security Question {0} must contain at least one letter or number.
Answer to the Security Question {0} and Confirm Answer {0} do not match.
